title: Organization Culture Schema
description: The shared values, practices, symbols, and traditions that define this organization's identity and shape its members' behavior and worldview.

value.description: A fundamental principle or belief held by the organization and expected to be embraced by its members.

description.description: Explanation of how this value manifests in the organization's decisions, policies, and members' behavior.

core_values.description: The fundamental principles and beliefs that guide the organization's decisions and define what its members consider most important.

name.description: The title or designation for this specific ceremony or practice.

description.description: Detailed account of how this ritual is performed, including required participants, actions, and settings.

purpose.description: The function this ritual serves within the organization, explaining why it continues to be performed.

rituals.description: Ceremonial practices and formalized procedures that reinforce the organization's values, commemorate its history, or mark significant transitions for its members.

name.description: The identifier for this emblem, icon, or symbolic element used by the organization.

description.description: Detailed account of the symbol's appearance, including colors, shapes, and design elements.

meaning.description: The significance and symbolism behind this visual representation.

symbols.description: Visual emblems, insignias, colors, or icons that represent the organization's identity, history, or values.
